text: The way Trump relates to his base reminds me a lot of the way big tech companies talk to their users. In tech it's called [%search: FUD%]. You can't tell who's lying a lot of the time. They take advantage of the fact that their customers are confused, and they try to keep them that way. IBM as an example made many billions off this approach over decades. There are exceptions, companies who value their customers and users enough to tell them the truth. Not many, and not always.
